III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10123 Staff sufficiency
Section (1) A facility shall have a staffing pattern of administrative,
Description supervisory, direct care, and other staff sufficient to perform the
prescribed functions required by these administrative rules and to
provide for the needs, protection, and supervision of the residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 03/30/23 or 04/01/23 Youth A was put in a restraint by two
staff members. Youth A received a chipped tooth due to the
restraint. Youth A escalated during class and was taken down the
hall. Each staff member held an arm. They told him to get on the
ground or they would put him on the ground. Youth A refused to
go on the ground. Staff put out their legs to trip him and he fell.
They were still holding his arms and he could not catch himself, so
he chipped his tooth on the floor.
Investigation Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 were interviewed face-to-
face at the facility, on 4/20/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. They reported being aware of the incident and provided a
copy of the incident report. They also reported not knowing how
the tooth was chipped during the restraint. They described Youth
A as having significant problems following directions and has
attacked staff three times since being lodged in the facility. Youth
A is currently on “Administrative Intervention” because of his
violent acting out. They report this intervention involves a strong
focus on helping Youth A use the Cognitive Behavior Therapy
skills to regulate his emotions and avoid violence. Nursing staff
observed Youth A the same day and a dentist the next day. Youth
involved in a restraint are required to be observed by nursing staff
following the restraint.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/20/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
receiving “bad news” from his Probation Officer the day of the
incident. After speaking with his Probation Officer, he went back
into the classroom. He also reported telling staff and the teacher
that he did not want to do any work and just sit and think about the
information he received. He reported the teacher gave him an
2

assignment on a piece of paper of which he “wrinkled up and
threw on the ground”. This resulted in Staff 4 issuing him a 5-
minute time out which he refused to take. Once refusing, he ran
out of the room and down the hallway. He reported “the time out
was not necessary” and only caused him to become “madder.”
Staff 1 caught him in the hall and started the restraint. He
described Staff 1 had his right arm and Staff 2 had his left arm,
then they both told him to get on the ground. Youth A refused to
comply, but Staff 1 and Staff 2 were able to get him on the ground.
He described Staff 2 put his leg in front of Youth A and tripped him
causing him to go to the ground. After being put into mechanical
restraints, Youth A was helped up and Staff 1 and Staff 2 escorted
him towards the unit where his bedroom was located. Youth A
reported trying to trip Staff 1 and Staff 2 during this time but was
unsuccessful. Once in the unit, Youth A continued to resist and
fight with Staff 1 and Staff 2 before going to the ground for a
second time. While on the ground, Staff 1 grabbed the back of his
head and “slammed” his head to the ground, breaking his tooth.
Youth A stopped resisting and fighting at this time and was helped
up and escorted to his bedroom. He reported the other staff
present were Staff 3, Staff 5, and Supervisor 1 but no other youth
witnessed the incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/20/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
the incident began when Youth A received “bad news” from his
Probation Officer. Staff 1 walked Youth A back to his classroom
and told Staff 5 in the classroom he needed some time because
he was upset. Staff 1 was called to assist another situation and
left the classroom. He then received a call for assistance about
10-minutes later and when reaching the area, he heard someone
running down the hallway. When he caught up with Youth A,
Youth A sat on the floor refusing to move. Staff 1 reported using
the Handle with Care technique of helping Youth A up and
escorting him to his room. He also reported Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff
3, Staff 5, Supervisor 1, and Supervisor 2 involved were talking to
Youth A to deescalate him. Youth A was “dead weight” when they
were escorting him while trying to kick staff. Staff 1 described
“dead weight” as Youth A had his feet on the ground but refused
to walk himself. Once they entered the unit, Youth A pushed
against the door frame causing Staff 1 and Staff 2 to become
unbalanced resulting in Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 2 going to the
floor. Staff 1 reported this is when Youth A attempted to bite his
arm and ended up chipping his tooth on the floor. Staff 1 denied
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Supervisor 1, and Supervisor 2 used any
inappropriate techniques and no one ever grabbed Youth A’s
head slamming it to the floor. He also denied using any type of
“leg sweep” to trip Youth A. Staff 1 did remember hearing Youth A
3

yelling about his tooth and reported a nurse observed him
following the restraint.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/20/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
receiving a “assistance call” and when arriving on the scene, Staff
1 and Supervisor 1 were physically managing Youth A. Youth A
was in a neutral position (laying on the ground) fighting staff. Staff
2 switched with Supervisor 1 after he “deployed mechanical
restraints”. He reported Supervisor 1 directed Staff 1 and himself
to move Youth A to his unit. Youth A attempted to prevent being
moved to his unit by dragging his feet and pushing against staff.
Once they reached the door to the unit, Staff 5 held the door open,
and Youth A attempted to kick her while trying to headbutt Staff 2.
Staff 2 reported this action by Youth A caused himself and Staff 2
to struggle with their balance causing them to go back to the floor.
He reported not being aware of any blood and not knowing when
Youth A chipped his tooth. He denied anyone pushed or shoved
Youth A in any manner, and he had no concerns about the staff’s
use of the restraint techniques.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed by phone, on
4/20/2023. A message had been left for the Foster Care Worker
prior to this phone call. She reported Youth A is a dual ward and
informed he was seen by a dentist after chipping his tooth. Youth
A also told her he refused to comply and ended up in a restraint.
He told her he tripped over staff’s feet and when they did not let
him go, he “face planted on the floor.”
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
being in his office when he received an “assistance call” and ran
out of his office to assist. He admitted to authorizing the
mechanical restraints when Youth A became aggressive and
refused to follow directions. Youth A became more aggressive
when reaching the unit door and was placed on the ground
appropriately by Staff 1 and Staff 2 just inside the doorway. He
also reported not recalling how Youth A’s tooth was chipped. He
reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 used the Handle with Care techniques
appropriately and he had no concerns about their actions.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
being a “floater” the day of the incident and was headed to the
classroom that Youth A had left. When he arrived, Youth A was
standing in the hallway with Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 attempting
to deescalate the situation. Youth A went “dead weight” and
refused to follow directions. Supervisor 2 also reported Youth A
4

began to cry and said he wanted to die after getting bad news
from his Probation Officer. He reported he only observed the
situation and had no concerns about Staff 1 and Staff 2’s
intervention. He also reported Youth A attempted to bite, kick, and
hit Staff 1 and Staff 2 and no one pushed or shoved Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported
being with Supervisor 2 when they received a message that Youth
A needed to go back to his unit. She gave the same report as
other staff and reported she took over the efforts to deescalate
Youth A during the restraint. Youth A kicked off the door frame to
the unit at which time Staff 1 and Staff 2 placed him back into a
neutral (on the floor) position. She denied observing anyone
pushing or being inappropriate with Youth A. She reported being a
Handle with Care trainer and found no concerns with staff’s use of
the techniques when restraining Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
being in the classroom Youth A left from and issuing the “time-out”
to Youth A. He was unable to recall what Youth A was upset over
but the time-out came after Youth A threw the homework
assignment off his desk after receiving it from the teacher. Staff 4
also reported calling for a “floater” after Youth A left the room with
Staff 5 following him. Staff 4 was not involved in the restraint and
never left the classroom during the incident.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone, on 5/3/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Her interview was consistent
with the incident report she completed. She reported the incident
began in the classroom when Youth A left the classroom without
permission. She reported being kicked by Youth A when he
entered the unit during the restraint, and she only heard about his
broken tooth after the incident. Staff 5 reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
used appropriate techniques during the restraint, and she never
observed Youth A’s face hitting the floor because she had gone to
his room to remove his personal items.
Staff 6 was interviewed via phone, on 5/3/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 6 gave the same report
as other staff interviewed and what he had written in the incident
report. He reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 were appropriate during the
restraint and did not observe any pushing or shoving by Staff 1
and Staff 2. He believed they went to a neutral position (Youth A
on the floor) when they entered the unit because Youth A caused
balance issues with his fighting the restraint. He reported Staff 1
5

and Staff 2 used appropriate techniques during the restraint, and
he never observed Youth A’s face hitting the floor.
On 5/11/23, a conference call was held with MDHHS worker, and
they reported no findings to their investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
Updated Service Plan 1/11/23-3/20/23 dated 3/20/23. This report
indicates the Foster Care worker met with Youth A on 3/31/23 and
informed him his next placement was a secure setting. It is also
noted Youth A “appeared to be in good spirits during the visit.” It
is also documented Youth A is having difficulty with the facility’s
daily routine.
Juvenile Detention Center Status Report. This report has no
date but appears to cover a time period until 4/11/23. It is
documented on 4/11/23, Youth A is referred to Rite of Passage for
his treatment placement.
Incident Report dated 3/28/23 at 1:16 PM.
• The primary section of this report was written by Staff 5
who was present at the beginning of the incident. It is
documented Youth A received a 5-minute time out (5MTO)
for being disrespectful towards the teacher and swearing at
staff. Youth A then broke a pencil resulting in a 30+30+5 for
“destruction of property”. She documented informing Youth
A she would check with the supervisor about his request for
a “personal time out” but he had to take the 5MTO first. At
this point, it is documented Youth A left the room and Staff
5 followed him while he began to run, and she called for
assistance. It is also documented Youth A kicked her in the
leg as described in interviews when he was escorted on to
the unit.
• Staff 6 wrote the first supplemental section. He
documented responding to an assistance call and finding
Youth A running through the halls while agitated. As staff
were trying to verbally deescalate Youth A, Youth A
became physically combative, and placed in a neutral
position (on the ground). Youth A was placed in mechanical
restrains before being escorted to the unit. He also
documented Youth A kicking Staff 5 when entering the unit
along with “becoming more combative by kicking, biting at
and headbutting staff.
• Staff 4 wrote the second supplemental section. He
documented Youth A received a 5MTO after ripping up a
6

worksheet he received from the teacher. He also
documented Youth A asked for a “personal time out” and
was told by Staff 5 that she would check with the supervisor
once he completed his 5MTO. As documented in other
sections, Youth A left the room and began to run down the
hall.
• Staff 1 wrote the third supplemental section. The
documentation matches Staff 1’s verbal interview.
• Staff 2 wrote the fourth supplemental section. He
documents similar part of the incident as he described in
his verbal interview. He added in this document being
directed by Supervisor 1 to deploy mechanical restraints
because of Youth A ‘s aggressive behaviors.
• Staff 3 wrote the fifth supplemental section. He documents
responding to an assistance call and finding Youth A
running away from staff. He was able to block Youth A’s
from going any further and described the incident from that
point as he did in his interview. He documented noticing
Youth A bleeding from the mouth and notifying medical
staff.
• Supervisor 1 wrote the sixth supplemental section. He
documents responding to an assistance call and having
Youth A refusing to go to his room. This resulted in the
restraint to assist him to his room. It is documented Youth A
became resist violently resulting in mechanical restraints
being used. He documented the attempts by Youth A to
assault staff once in the unit before being placed in his
room.
Incident report (medical) dated 3/28/23. This document outlines
the medical intervention provided to Youth A following the
incident. It is documented Youth A had a superficial abrasion to
his right hip, blood to his lower lip and minimal swelling on his lip.
Youth A was given Ibuprofen 400MG, ice, and a dental exam was
requested.
Use of Force-Male Nursing Clinical Guideline 605 dated
3/28/23. This document outlines the observations of medical staff
following the restraint of Youth A on 3/28/23. Youth A described
the incident as he got bad news from his Probation Officer causing
him to run down a hallway before stopping and sitting. When
asked to get up he refused, and staff used Handle with Care to
escort him to his room. Youth A reported pain in his lower lip and
right hip, needing medical care. Documented is Youth A’s chipped
right upper tooth, superficial abrasion to right hip and blood on
7

lower lip and swelling. Medical care provided is documented as
Ibuprofen 400MG, ice and a referral for dental care.
American Mobile Dental mobile medical support dated
3/28/23. This is a two-page form documenting the results of the
medical care provided by the dentist. It is documented Youth A
has a “#8-MILDF fracture and is recommended for a re-evaluation
in a month”. Youth A is recommended to visit an outside DDS to
receive a filling once released from care.
Email notification of discipline involving Youth A dated
3/28/23. This email was sent to Kent County Family Court &
Juvenile Detention Activity Notification. This document sent by
Supervisor 1 requests Youth A be placed on Administrative
Intervention and documents Youth A’s violent behaviors during the
restraint involved in this incident.
Administrator 2 response to the request to place Youth A on
Administrative Intervention. He concurred Youth A should be
placed on Administrative Intervention and supports this decision
with the prior two incidents in which Youth A engaged in
assaulting or attempting assault of staff. He outlines the conditions
of this Administrative Intervention.
Special Programming for Youth A signed 4/3/2023. This
document outlines the reason for special programming as Youth
A’s difficulty to emotionally regulate himself and struggles with
impulsivity. Staff’s interactions are documented as are the
behaviors they should look for and Youth A’s triggers. Youth A’s
identified coping skills are documented. Youth A is provided a
“veto” when triggered and staff may request a “veto” if he appears
agitated. This “veto” involves Youth A spending 15-minutes in his
room. Youth A is allowed to bring a stress ball into class to use
when stressed. Staff are to continue to meet with Youth A to
provide support and discuss progress.
Staff 1 Human Resources file. Staff 1 had one written reprimand
that occurred on 8/11/2021 no related to this investigation.
Documentation indicates he last completed a refresher of the
Handle with Care behavior management technique on 11/8/2022
and completed thirty-one training hours for 2022.
Staff 2 Human Resources file. Staff 2 had no disciplinary action
documented in his file. Documentation indicates he last completed
a refresher of the Handle with Care behavior management
technique on 11/8/2022 and completed 24.5 training hours for
2022.
8

Detention Procedures Manual Resident Management 600
dated 8/24/2016. Documentation in this procedure manual states
physical force is limited to those techniques from the Handle with
Care Behavior Management System Model guidelines. These
guidelines shall be used only in such cases for moving an
unwilling resident from one area to another. The use of
mechanical restraints shall only be used in escorting a resident to
a secure area within the facility following a physical restraint
incident. In this case the document states, the use of mechanical
restraints can be approved by an authorizing person immediately
following an incident requiring a resident to be physically
restrained.
The facility provided a video recording review of the incident.
The view from the camera shows the area just inside the door to
the unit Youth A is lodged in with Staff 5 approaching the door.
Staff can be seen bringing Youth A into the room with Staff 5
holding the door open. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are holding Youth A by
his arms and shoulders. Youth A is observed kicking and making
aggressive moves before Staff 1, Staff 2 and Youth A move
towards the floor. It does appear that they move quickly to the
floor, but Staff 1 and Staff 2 never lose their hold on Youth A.
Youth A is thrashing his head around before he can be heard
yelling his tooth is broke. At no time does any staff put their hands
on his head or push him towards the ground.
Video Recording Review. The facility provided a video recording
of the incident. The view is of the main door inside the unit they
were bringing Youth A into. Staff 5 is observed coming into the
view from the left and moving quickly towards the door. He opens
the door and appears to walk out of the door. A couple of seconds
later, Staff 2 (right side) and Staff 1 (left side) escort Youth A into
the room. Youth A is at a 45-degree angle to the floor before both
Staff 1 and Staff 2 place Youth A on the floor. This occurred as
Youth A began to kick and violently struggle. Both staff are on
their knees with Youth A laying on the floor. Youth A is yelling and
twisting his body with his head on the floor. Staff 2 has his hand
on the upper part of Youth A’s back but not touching his head.
Staff 1 has a hand on the upper part of Youth A’s back/shoulder.
Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, Staff 3, and Staff 5 are observed
standing to the side and behind the staff and Youth A on the floor.
The staff then assist Youth A to his feet and escort him to his
room.
Site walk-through. The hallway and unit were observed, and all
appeared as in the video. The unit was appropriately stocked with
items as required and there did not appear to be any obstructions
or obstacles in the area.
9

Analysis Based upon interviews, written document, and video recording
there is no evidence that supports staff caused Youth A to hit his
head on the floor causing his tooth to chip.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that this investigation be closed with no change made to the
license of this Court Operated Facility
